summary:
Upgrade your thinking partner üß†
Here‚Äôs my custom instructions:

Role
Act as a collaborative thinking partner. Build ideas with me, not for me. No presenting, pitching, or selling my own ideas back to me.

How to Work
	‚Ä¢	Treat inputs as incomplete fragments
	‚Ä¢	Fill gaps, connect dots, and elevate ideas without hijacking intent
	‚Ä¢	Simplify and sharpen, but don‚Äôt kill ambition
	‚Ä¢	Call out overengineering or fluff plainly

Style
	‚Ä¢	Plain, direct, conversational
	‚Ä¢	No hype, no TED-talk tone, no Apple-keynote structure
	‚Ä¢	Minimal formatting, paragraphs over bullets

Structure
	‚Ä¢	Use light structure only if it reduces cognitive load
	‚Ä¢	Summarize only to align or expose gaps, not to persuade

Teaching Mode
When I ask to learn something:
	‚Ä¢	Teach like a senior expert explaining to another senior operator
	‚Ä¢	Focus on mental models, systems, tradeoffs, and common mistakes
	‚Ä¢	Avoid step-by-step tutorials or low-level implementation unless I ask

Interaction Rules
	‚Ä¢	Ask questions only if progress is blocked
	‚Ä¢	No multiple follow-ups
	‚Ä¢	No generic wrap-up prompts

Avoid
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúGreat question‚Äù, ‚Äúhere‚Äôs why this matters‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Over-structuring
	‚Ä¢	Completing ideas for me instead of with me

summary:
Made with @googlegemini ‚ú®

Yes the reel came out kinda low quality coz I‚Äôm sick, and I can‚Äôt wait more to progress in the project but i wanted to show the minimum viable prototype to anyone who‚Äôs interested. What you could do with least resources.
My voice is messed up so @elevenlabsio was a huge help for the most of the voice over, also trying out @capcutapp for the first time ever, its awesome and it generated the AI background music that I love!
This project series is supposed to get progressively professional over time as I replace the sensor, the packaging, the fans, camputing unit and what not, there is so much beauty to the process!

summary:
‚ú® Finding my True North ‚Äî Surya

Connection. Direction. Identity.
Camp EDI @segaldesign wasn‚Äôt just about learning the tools, it was about realizing what I could create with them.

For me, that became Surya ‚Äî an international clock that connects my family across time zones.
üå∏ The flowers bloom when they wake and close when they sleep.
üí° The LEDs illuminate time and connection through light.
‚öôÔ∏è The automation ties it all together, quietly syncing lives across continents.

What started as a project became a reminder ‚Äî of home, of purpose, of balance.

3 things I‚Äôm proud of:
ü™ª 3D-printed flowers that move like breathing petals
üî≤ Laser-cut mandala base etched in wood
üîå A custom microcontroller board bringing it all to life

#CampEDI

summary:
If you have any idea how plotter Z axis works then you‚Äôll realise how idiotic this design is. If you don‚Äôt then its actually a great piece of engineering.
Rack and pinion mechanism, magnetic top and bottom pieces, Y axis tightening screw, an elegant but over engineered piece of hardware.
But
Its a janky setup with a single linear G2 belt since I had to glue it together - need a better belt attaching and tightening mechanism
The head was tilted and error maximised - pen needs to be at the centre of the head, 4 linear bearings to straighten
The rack and pinion mechanism made pen depth absolute - make pen‚Äôs force variable
caption:
If you have any idea how plotter Z axis works then you‚Äôll realise how idiotic this design is. If you don‚Äôt then its actually a great piece of engineering.
Rack and pinion mechanism, magnetic top and bottom pieces, Y axis tightening screw, an elegant but over engineered piece of hardware.
But
Its a janky setup with a single linear G2 belt since I had to glue it together - need a better belt attaching and tightening mechanism
The head was tilted and error maximised - pen needs to be at the centre of the head, 4 linear bearings to straighten
The rack and pinion mechanism made pen depth absolute - make pen‚Äôs force variable

summary:
You should trust the process. Here‚Äôs my top 3 recent sculptures (they‚Äôre a year old), all 3 combined follow a ladder of expression and realism.
The Drake is a mythical creature and allowed me to present my take on it, there is no one exact form and allowed for unrestricted expression all the while trying to make him look realistic.
The skull is deeply rooted in realism and the form is already set, my experiment in expression here led to the intrigued look.
The overthinker is a culmination of the learnings from its predecessors. First it takes inspiration from Auguste rodin‚Äòs The Thinker which portrays contemplation and introspection, then it takes it a notch above - the additional hands add to thought process, taking away from pure contemplation to being stuck in the contemplative loop, the moot process of overthinking. The pok√©mon Machamp fit here perfectly, might of the fighter pok√©mon stuck in introspective loop throws some shade at the artist himself. The 2D creature had to be imagined in 3D with realistic anatomy - it drew realism where there was none. The expression here is profound, for me it shows the powerlessness of powerful beings in their pursuit of perfection.

You should trust the process, and before the process you must trust yourself to be the person who follows through the process
caption:
You should trust the process. Here‚Äôs my top 3 recent sculptures (they‚Äôre a year old), all 3 combined follow a ladder of expression and realism.
The Drake is a mythical creature and allowed me to present my take on it, there is no one exact form and allowed for unrestricted expression all the while trying to make him look realistic.
The skull is deeply rooted in realism and the form is already set, my experiment in expression here led to the intrigued look.
The overthinker is a culmination of the learnings from its predecessors. First it takes inspiration from Auguste rodin‚Äòs The Thinker which portrays contemplation and introspection, then it takes it a notch above - the additional hands add to thought process, taking away from pure contemplation to being stuck in the contemplative loop, the moot process of overthinking. The pok√©mon Machamp fit here perfectly, might of the fighter pok√©mon stuck in introspective loop throws some shade at the artist himself. The 2D creature had to be imagined in 3D with realistic anatomy - it drew realism where there was none. The expression here is profound, for me it shows the powerlessness of powerful beings in their pursuit of perfection.

You should trust the process, and before the process you must trust yourself to be the person who follows through the process

summary:
Not everything needs to be built from the scratch, many of my projects till date were for me to learn the underlying tech.
Here is where I pivot. üîÑ

Here I tried to create the simplest solution that checked all my boxes:
1. Smart 
2. Small
3. Simple 
4. Durable
5. Can handle Ender‚Äôs load
6. Cheap
7. Manual switches too
8. And of course pleasant to look at

The prewired board actually came in cheaper than individual panels, and it saved me a lot of wiring time too.
The combined board is also great price for what it does, 600 rupees for the whole board, it uses UART from the ESP-01 to control the relay, I‚Äôve connected it to my home assistant which orchestrates everything.
#diy #electronics #microcontroller #esp8266 #smarthome
caption:
Not everything needs to be built from the scratch, many of my projects till date were for me to learn the underlying tech.
Here is where I pivot. üîÑ

1. Smart 
2. Small
3. Simple 
4. Durable
5. Can handle Ender‚Äôs load
6. Cheap
7. Manual switches too
8. And of course pleasant to look at

The prewired board actually came in cheaper than individual panels, and it saved me a lot of wiring time too.
The combined board is also great price for what it does, 600 rupees for the whole board, it uses UART from the ESP-01 to control the relay, I‚Äôve connected it to my home assistant which orchestrates everything.
#diy #electronics #microcontroller #esp8266 #smarthome

summary:
The civil engineer in me is proud I found this!
As TenTech explains in his video, in US this layering technique was introduced in 1959, 6 decades later its still not open for public use due to new patents. Since no patent has been filed in UK or India we are able to make use of this tech that frankly every slicer should have inbuilt.
Follow TenTech‚Äôs video to achieve the results, its a simple python post processing script.

Now what did my super accurate and scientific test tell me?
In pure shearing strength test I saw ~10% increase, which in itself is significant but what i liked the most was seen in large area prints.
Due to the cooling between the different layers of a print the interstitial points are a weak spot, I‚Äôve noticed forces parallel to this sometimes cleave off the whole print in half, this was totally fixed with brick layers, forces and trauma to a side of the print does not affect the nearby parts at all!
Hoping we get to see this as a default option in all slicers of the future!
#3dprinting #electronics #diy #tech
caption:
The civil engineer in me is proud I found this!
As TenTech explains in his video, in US this layering technique was introduced in 1959, 6 decades later its still not open for public use due to new patents. Since no patent has been filed in UK or India we are able to make use of this tech that frankly every slicer should have inbuilt.
Follow TenTech‚Äôs video to achieve the results, its a simple python post processing script.

Now what did my super accurate and scientific test tell me?
In pure shearing strength test I saw ~10% increase, which in itself is significant but what i liked the most was seen in large area prints.
Due to the cooling between the different layers of a print the interstitial points are a weak spot, I‚Äôve noticed forces parallel to this sometimes cleave off the whole print in half, this was totally fixed with brick layers, forces and trauma to a side of the print does not affect the nearby parts at all!
Hoping we get to see this as a default option in all slicers of the future!
#3dprinting #electronics #diy #tech

summary:
It‚Äôs Holiday season and our team decided to play Secret Santa!
A perfect opportunity for a functional personalised gift!
Also a perfect opportunity to create magnet inserted prints, I ended up using all methods, pausing mid print to change filaments and insert magnets in cavities as well as just gluing them in holes.
The concept was to create someone‚Äôs initials that could become a fridge magnet and connect with each other for easy travel, why would someone travel with these though?
Because these double as phone stand as well!
Lastly the base perfectly fits into our office dividers, with magnetic attachments, they‚Äôre the perfect display and resting spot.
#diy #3dprinting #secretsanta #christmas
caption:
It‚Äôs Holiday season and our team decided to play Secret Santa!
A perfect opportunity for a functional personalised gift!
Also a perfect opportunity to create magnet inserted prints, I ended up using all methods, pausing mid print to change filaments and insert magnets in cavities as well as just gluing them in holes.
The concept was to create someone‚Äôs initials that could become a fridge magnet and connect with each other for easy travel, why would someone travel with these though?
Because these double as phone stand as well!
Lastly the base perfectly fits into our office dividers, with magnetic attachments, they‚Äôre the perfect display and resting spot.
#diy #3dprinting #secretsanta #christmas

summary:
Meet Helios! üåû
It‚Äôs the culmination of many of my skills, testing not only mine but my 3D printer‚Äôs tolerances.
All parts for Helios was designed in such a way that they print without supports. This was one of the largest designs I could think of on my print bed.
This also tested my capabilities in mechanical modelling, thanks to you all for recommending to use a ring gear.
The drilling at the start was not necessary but I did print the initial base without the wire cutout, to avoid waste I just drilled instead.
For an instant IOT addition I‚Äôve added a smart lamp in there, making the project a physical first but with smart convinces product.
The files for the lamp will be on my thingyverse and GitHub!#
Tell me your thoughts on the project in the comments!

#diy #lamp #3dprinting #iot
caption:
Meet Helios! üåû
It‚Äôs the culmination of many of my skills, testing not only mine but my 3D printer‚Äôs tolerances.
All parts for Helios was designed in such a way that they print without supports. This was one of the largest designs I could think of on my print bed.
This also tested my capabilities in mechanical modelling, thanks to you all for recommending to use a ring gear.
The drilling at the start was not necessary but I did print the initial base without the wire cutout, to avoid waste I just drilled instead.
For an instant IOT addition I‚Äôve added a smart lamp in there, making the project a physical first but with smart convinces product.
The files for the lamp will be on my thingyverse and GitHub!#
Tell me your thoughts on the project in the comments!

#diy #lamp #3dprinting #iot

summary:
When did I start making DIY versions of all smart devices on the market üòÖ
Most of my projects come from necessity, of features or price point.
Cool additions in this smart relay is the segmented led strip that lights up corresponding to the turned on socket, it can also be programmed for any other automations like notifications!
For my own prototyping needs I‚Äôve exposed quick connect from the last relay on to the side so I don‚Äôt have to use a plug at all!
Not just that, it has an IR sensor embedded on the side that can be mapped to any action.
Everything is HomeKit and Homeassistant compatible now!

#diy #electronics #microcontroller #tech #esp8266 #techinnovation #smarthome

When did I start making DIY versions of all smart devices on the market üòÖ

For my own prototyping needs I‚Äôve exposed quick connect from the last relay on to the side so I don‚Äôt have to use a plug at all!
Not just that, it has an IR sensor embedded on the side that can be mapped to any action.
Everything is HomeKit and Homeassistant compatible now!

#diy #electronics #microcontroller #tech #esp8266 #techinnovation #smarthome

summary:
I‚Äôve updated my light to run on ESPHome, with that I was able to add special reverse integrations to control other lights in my home with the buttons on this light.

ESPHome creates custom firmware for ESP devices, making smart home automation easy. Here‚Äôs why I prefer it with Home Assistant:

1. **Custom Firmware**: ESPHome builds firmware specifically for your ESP devices, tailored to your needs and fitting budget.
 
2. **Easy Integration**: Once set up, devices are automatically detected and managed by Home Assistant, allowing for real-time control. You can even update it OTA.

3. **No Coding Needed**: Instead of writing complex code, you just use simple YAML files to configure your devices. ESPHome does the rest. Almost no code, it‚Äôs similar to JSON editing.

4. **Quick Setup**: Adding new sensors or devices is as easy as updating a file and reloading. Home Assistant picks them up right away. I legit started and ended this in a week, including video production and learning.

#diy #electronics #tech #microcontroller #esp8266 #esp 
#homeautomation #homeassistant #esphome
caption:
I‚Äôve updated my light to run on ESPHome, with that I was able to add special reverse integrations to control other lights in my home with the buttons on this light.

ESPHome creates custom firmware for ESP devices, making smart home automation easy. Here‚Äôs why I prefer it with Home Assistant:

1. **Custom Firmware**: ESPHome builds firmware specifically for your ESP devices, tailored to your needs and fitting budget.
 
2. **Easy Integration**: Once set up, devices are automatically detected and managed by Home Assistant, allowing for real-time control. You can even update it OTA.

3. **No Coding Needed**: Instead of writing complex code, you just use simple YAML files to configure your devices. ESPHome does the rest. Almost no code, it‚Äôs similar to JSON editing.

4. **Quick Setup**: Adding new sensors or devices is as easy as updating a file and reloading. Home Assistant picks them up right away. I legit started and ended this in a week, including video production and learning.

#diy #electronics #tech #microcontroller #esp8266 #esp 
#homeautomation #homeassistant #esphome

summary:
This project isn‚Äôt about my singular goal to create the smart curtain bot, it‚Äôs about reaching the ability to make a project like this. Not just this project, but projects in general.
It‚Äôs about my understanding of materials and sourcing them properly in right prices.
It‚Äôs about my CAD and 3D printing skills that repeatedly hone themselves with every iteration.
It‚Äôs about learning to embrace the iterative development process, knowing that I started at the bottom rung of it.

It‚Äôs all about the failures along the way, and what they‚Äôve taught me. 
 
#diy #electronics #smarthome #microcontroller #tech #3dprinting
caption:
This project isn‚Äôt about my singular goal to create the smart curtain bot, it‚Äôs about reaching the ability to make a project like this. Not just this project, but projects in general.
It‚Äôs about my understanding of materials and sourcing them properly in right prices.
It‚Äôs about my CAD and 3D printing skills that repeatedly hone themselves with every iteration.
It‚Äôs about learning to embrace the iterative development process, knowing that I started at the bottom rung of it.

It‚Äôs all about the failures along the way, and what they‚Äôve taught me. 
 
#diy #electronics #smarthome #microcontroller #tech #3dprinting

summary:
DIY 2D CNC Plotter is here! ‚öôÔ∏è
Powered by an Arduino Nano, it uses a special fork of GRBL to run on 28BYJ motors and ULN2003 Motor driver.
This took me months to imagine, learn, code, print and tweak.
You can find all the parts on my Thinverse (after 24 hours)
I‚Äôll put further videos detailing how I made this and all the understanding needed to create one of your own.

Ask your doubts in the comments if you‚Äôre currently stuck somewhere.

summary:
Air Gun v3 is here! üî´
Also known as air mouse, this is the third iteration of it and it is getting better and better!
I‚Äôve added all necessary mouse functions including the extra two back and forward buttons found in productivity mouses.
I was able to integrate a joystick which currently is only mapped to scrolling.
As a Easter egg I‚Äôve put in the new switch, it essentially should allow me to switch between a keyboard mapped joystick to a scroll mapped joystick.
Also clicking the joystick is middle click obviously.
All previous movement functions have been retained.

#diy #electronics #esp32 #microcontroller #techinnovation #tech

Air Gun v3 is here! üî´
Also known as air mouse, this is the third iteration of it and it is getting better and better!
I‚Äôve added all necessary mouse functions including the extra two back and forward buttons found in productivity mouses.
I was able to integrate a joystick which currently is only mapped to scrolling.
As a Easter egg I‚Äôve put in the new switch, it essentially should allow me to switch between a keyboard mapped joystick to a scroll mapped joystick.
Also clicking the joystick is middle click obviously.
All previous movement functions have been retained.

#diy #electronics #esp32 #microcontroller #techinnovation #tech

summary:
Here I‚Äôve achieved a feat on my 8yr old MI tablet running super old android that I couldn‚Äôt on my latest and greatest iPhone 15 pro!
Yes you read that right, I can‚Äôt do this on an iPhone.
This is due to security restrictions and need for permissions for everything in ios, it has definitely made it more secure but we did lose some functionality.
So here I was able to fetch the device orientation details as yaw pitch and role (alpha beta gamma), then I was able to map it to steering control, I tried mapping the movement to forward and backward tilt but I‚Äôm not good enough driver to control it like that.
Anyway,  I was also able to have some proper mapping and create a AsyncWebserver with a websocket for fast and reliable connection. This was one of the biggest problem statement for me as typical R.C modules cost 10x the actual cost of this project. (7-10k)

Request me in the comments to share steps and how to create this on @instructables, and if actually people want it , I‚Äôll make it!

#tinkertronics #diy #electronics #esp8266 
#microcontroller #car #rc #rccars #mechanicalengineering  #Conceptbytes
caption:
Here I‚Äôve achieved a feat on my 8yr old MI tablet running super old android that I couldn‚Äôt on my latest and greatest iPhone 15 pro!
Yes you read that right, I can‚Äôt do this on an iPhone.
This is due to security restrictions and need for permissions for everything in ios, it has definitely made it more secure but we did lose some functionality.
So here I was able to fetch the device orientation details as yaw pitch and role (alpha beta gamma), then I was able to map it to steering control, I tried mapping the movement to forward and backward tilt but I‚Äôm not good enough driver to control it like that.
Anyway,  I was also able to have some proper mapping and create a AsyncWebserver with a websocket for fast and reliable connection. This was one of the biggest problem statement for me as typical R.C modules cost 10x the actual cost of this project. (7-10k)

Request me in the comments to share steps and how to create this on @instructables, and if actually people want it , I‚Äôll make it!

#tinkertronics #diy #electronics #esp8266 
#microcontroller #car #rc #rccars #mechanicalengineering  #Conceptbytes

summary:
I‚Äôve used the EXG Pill from @myupsidedownlab to get the EMG data. Then used python to understand and visualise it, finally the python scripts checks the amplitude and volume under the graph to classify different reps.
Electromyography (EMG) is a technique used to measure and analyze the electrical activity produced by skeletal muscles, providing valuable insights into muscle health, performance, and neuromuscular function.

- Non-invasive measurement: Surface EMG sensors capture muscle activity through electrodes placed on the skin.
- Muscle performance: Helps assess muscle strength, fatigue, and coordination.
- Clinical applications: Used in diagnosing neuromuscular disorders and guiding rehabilitation.
- Sports and fitness: Monitors muscle engagement and optimization during workouts.
- Research and development: Crucial for studying muscle function and developing advanced prosthetics and control systems.
caption:
I‚Äôve used the EXG Pill from @myupsidedownlab to get the EMG data. Then used python to understand and visualise it, finally the python scripts checks the amplitude and volume under the graph to classify different reps.
Electromyography (EMG) is a technique used to measure and analyze the electrical activity produced by skeletal muscles, providing valuable insights into muscle health, performance, and neuromuscular function.

- Non-invasive measurement: Surface EMG sensors capture muscle activity through electrodes placed on the skin.
- Muscle performance: Helps assess muscle strength, fatigue, and coordination.
- Clinical applications: Used in diagnosing neuromuscular disorders and guiding rehabilitation.
- Sports and fitness: Monitors muscle engagement and optimization during workouts.
- Research and development: Crucial for studying muscle function and developing advanced prosthetics and control systems.

summary:
This test is not measuring token input or output, rather it counts the characters generated, I‚Äôve made 2 metrics one to purely check the back end and one to see the real world front end difference. Let me know if you want to see the metrics for all tests, but in general model‚Äôs character generation speed increases with total generated size, ie. Character generation speed is higher for bigger paragraphs.
Here‚Äôs some other basic details on the new GPT-4o Mini model;

Replaces GPT-3.5 Turbo: OpenAI‚Äôs new GPT-4o Mini is designed to replace the GPT-3.5 Turbo.

Cost: 30 times cheaper than GPT-4o and significantly more affordable than GPT-3.5 Turbo.

Intelligence: Outperforms other mini models like Anthropic‚Äôs Claude Haiku and Google‚Äôs Gemini Flash in intelligence and capabilities.
caption:
This test is not measuring token input or output, rather it counts the characters generated, I‚Äôve made 2 metrics one to purely check the back end and one to see the real world front end difference. Let me know if you want to see the metrics for all tests, but in general model‚Äôs character generation speed increases with total generated size, ie. Character generation speed is higher for bigger paragraphs.
Here‚Äôs some other basic details on the new GPT-4o Mini model;

Replaces GPT-3.5 Turbo: OpenAI‚Äôs new GPT-4o Mini is designed to replace the GPT-3.5 Turbo.

Intelligence: Outperforms other mini models like Anthropic‚Äôs Claude Haiku and Google‚Äôs Gemini Flash in intelligence and capabilities.

summary:
I want to 3D print the light diffuser for a permanent open lightsaber. 3 considerations that I‚Äôve iterated on here are:
1. The wall thickness and infill for desired diffusion.
2. The internal rail that will hold the LED strip.
3. The connecting mechanism for the printed parts due to size constraints.

summary:
Here‚Äôs an overhaul and upgrade walkthrough of my WLED setup!
I‚Äôve used ESP8266 as the base and printed enclosure and connectors for it.
After installing WLED on it, we need to connect the correct GPIO with the LED strip.
Addressable RGB LED strips only have 3 pins- power, ground and input. Thus the setup is pretty straightforward.
I‚Äôve made sure to use a nice 5V 5A power supply to achieve high brightness and power such long strips.
Honestly lot of effort went into just creating the case and connectors, but man now it looks so professional. I love it.
caption:
Here‚Äôs an overhaul and upgrade walkthrough of my WLED setup!
I‚Äôve used ESP8266 as the base and printed enclosure and connectors for it.
After installing WLED on it, we need to connect the correct GPIO with the LED strip.
Addressable RGB LED strips only have 3 pins- power, ground and input. Thus the setup is pretty straightforward.
I‚Äôve made sure to use a nice 5V 5A power supply to achieve high brightness and power such long strips.
Honestly lot of effort went into just creating the case and connectors, but man now it looks so professional. I love it.

summary:
Many iterations for a project, but I love how this came to be. I had to make it robust and finally I ditched ChatGPT and wrote the code myself, did not take more than 30 min tbh, sometimes ChatGPT just takes you down an hallucinating pathway.
Anyway, it‚Äôs quite robust and listens well over internet, really no complaints here. Though, I‚Äôd love to add a door close servo, and a door bell/ camera and a rfid/nfc reader. Way in the future that is.

summary:
Why would I even do that though!
Here I‚Äôve setup local server with GPT-4o API.
I‚Äôve then setup IOS Shortcuts to effectively pass the images and text to the API and fetch the results.
Now ChatGPT is already available to download on my iPad why would I even do this, essentially this was a test to automate workflows. While ChatGPT app is there, there‚Äôs limited automation capabilities, which is opened up by the shortcuts app.
Secondly and the import part why I had to host a server, I want to essentially call GPT api‚Äôs through microcontrollers, more on why I want to do that later.
caption:
Why would I even do that though!
Here I‚Äôve setup local server with GPT-4o API.
I‚Äôve then setup IOS Shortcuts to effectively pass the images and text to the API and fetch the results.
Now ChatGPT is already available to download on my iPad why would I even do this, essentially this was a test to automate workflows. While ChatGPT app is there, there‚Äôs limited automation capabilities, which is opened up by the shortcuts app.
Secondly and the import part why I had to host a server, I want to essentially call GPT api‚Äôs through microcontrollers, more on why I want to do that later.

Getting a battery for it, getting a charging module for the battery, getting a step down module to get correct voltage, mess up the input voltage limits and get the correct converter, realise the converted value isn‚Äôt enough to power the board, get a boost converter for that, now make a chassis for the battery system.
.
Light work.

Can‚Äôt believe how it turned out to look so professional üë®‚Äçüè´ 
.

Getting a battery for it, getting a charging module for the battery, getting a step down module to get correct voltage, mess up the input voltage limits and get the correct converter, realise the converted value isn‚Äôt enough to power the board, get a boost converter for that, now make a chassis for the battery system.

The basic code can be used to create fun small games for events where each voice can be given a different personality and instruction set. Creating a murder mystery game with interactive AI bots can be one of my next projects too!

summary:
Smart Curtain Bot #2
We‚Äôve successfully created a roller for the curtain rod, while one of the roller will be moved by the stepper motor, the other one needs to move freely and I‚Äôll need a lot more experience to be able to 3D print an axle with proper tolerances. 
Thankfully I had an extra ball bearing that now I‚Äôm thinking of attaching to the other roller and now both the rollers can be joined by the stepper motor holder that and ball bearing connector.
caption:
Smart Curtain Bot #2
We‚Äôve successfully created a roller for the curtain rod, while one of the roller will be moved by the stepper motor, the other one needs to move freely and I‚Äôll need a lot more experience to be able to 3D print an axle with proper tolerances. 
Thankfully I had an extra ball bearing that now I‚Äôm thinking of attaching to the other roller and now both the rollers can be joined by the stepper motor holder that and ball bearing connector.

summary:
Might have hit a wall here, fact of the matter is - if you want proper linear force you have to use the right mechanism.
What I was trying to achieve was using an off axis servo‚Äôs force component in one direction transferred to another plane.
This heavy duty servo should be able to push the button in theory, if aligned to the button.

What would work here though?
Linear force requires linear actuators, they use electromagnetic solenoid to move a shaft linearly.
Might actually make this later someday to try it out but the hopes for a door closing mechanism seems distant for now.
I did try lighter servo oriented correctly but they were too light it seems.
caption:
Might have hit a wall here, fact of the matter is - if you want proper linear force you have to use the right mechanism.
What I was trying to achieve was using an off axis servo‚Äôs force component in one direction transferred to another plane.
This heavy duty servo should be able to push the button in theory, if aligned to the button.

What would work here though?
Linear force requires linear actuators, they use electromagnetic solenoid to move a shaft linearly.
Might actually make this later someday to try it out but the hopes for a door closing mechanism seems distant for now.
I did try lighter servo oriented correctly but they were too light it seems.

summary:
Usually the open source community has most things available readily but this is one those things that I noticed the open source community does not have any replacement for.
Most smart home appliances the idea is quite simple- just take a output device like a relay for a smart switch breaker,  a servo for switch bot, IR emitter for IR automation box, RGB Lights and so on. This project is dependent on controlling a stepper motor.

summary:
Wanted to add like 3 shelves and had to settle for 1.
Fixed and setup the lamp with some special geometric pink prints.
Added another lampshade to the overhead light for more soft lighting.
Was able to mount the spool holder to the wall to minimise any wobble.
Upgraded to an ikea bin.
Added the Allen key kit and filament cutter holder.
Powered the whole setup with my own smart spike.

summary:
üöÄ Using stepper motors to create a linear rail! Here‚Äôs why stepper motors are essential:

- **Precise Control:** Allows for exact positioning.
- **High Torque:** Great for demanding applications.
- **Reliability:** Consistent performance over time.

**Types of Motors:**
- **DC Motor:** Simple, variable speed, but less precise.
- **Servo Motor:** Offers high precision with feedback control.
- **Stepper Motor:** Combines precision and control, perfect for projects requiring exact movement.

Stay tuned to see the results! üîß‚ú® #TechInnovation #StepperMotor #DIYProjects #MakersGonnaMake

OpenCV is a powerful tool for image and video processing, making it easier to work with visual data. Mediapipe specializes in real-time, cross-platform machine learning solutions.

With these technologies, you can:
- Track hand movements for interactive applications üñêÔ∏è
- Apply facial filters and effects for enhanced selfies üì∏
- Develop gesture-based controls for smart devices üì±
